assumption.assumption: Bosch insiders (e.g., personnel, developers, project managers and solution providers involved in this project) are trusted to the extent that they are authorized
Third party software / libraries are trusted and are compatible, that is, when integrated with the TOE do not endanger it.
Diagnosis will be performed only through trusted hardware an trustworthy personal
Physical security and safety of the devices is the responsibility of the customer
assumption.assumption_comment: Physical security and safety of the device must be ensured by customer. Physical access of devices must be monitored and controlled by customer.

assumption.assumption: Connected devices follow robust security measures
assumption.assumption_comment: Updated antivirus software, firewalls, and other security features on devices shall be done by the users.

assumption.assumption: Physical access to networking equipment is restricted
Connectivity between Gateway and Internet is always available
Physical Security of the Gateway, NILM, MMUE and Access Point is the responsibility of the Customer
Routers and connected devices are regularly updated with the latest firmware and software patches
assumption.assumption_comment: Outdated firmware can expose vulnerabilities that attackers may exploit

SecGoals.objective_description: USB stack API should not expose sensitive information needed to access the system. USB stack API should not be tampered by MITM attacks to affect performance.
The data communication between the device and the WiFi network is confidential and must not be exposed.
The data communication between WiFi and the device must not be manipulated.
The WiFi Interface must be available to enable data communication between the network and device.
Strict access control should be implemented both physically to protect from unauthorized access.
WiFi module should always be available to provide WiFi connectivity among devices.
It is required that the configuration information sent from the user to the access point must not be exposed.
It is required that the configuration information sent from the user to the access point must not be tampered. Loss of integrity will impact the functionality of the system.
It is required that the WiFi access point is always up and made available to the user whenever required for configuration. Loss of availability will lead to Denial-of-service
WiFi Router should be protected from denial of service attacks
